justification: “We developed and administered the 'Intergenerational Probability Discounting Task,' which comprised four series of 11 dichotomous forced-choice trials… prompting participants to decide between saving a single individual from the current generation … and saving the lives of 10 individuals from a future generation with varying degrees of certainty.”
construct: Intergenerational probability discounting / preference for saving present vs. future lives

justification: “Study 2a … employed two modified versions of the discounting task: (1) the 'Varying Future Certainty Task (VFCT)'… each trial presented a choice between saving a single individual from the current generation with 50% certainty and saving the life of a single individual from a future generation with varying degrees of certainty.”
construct: Uncertainty tolerance for helping future beneficiaries

justification: “The VPCT was the same, except Option A represented saving a single individual from a future generation at 50% certainty and Option B represented saving a single individual from the present generation at varying degrees of certainty.”
construct: Uncertainty tolerance for helping present beneficiaries

justification: “Attitudes towards intergenerational beneficence were measured using the 28-item Longtermism Beliefs Scale (LBS)… which captures concern for protecting the welfare of future humans across four timeframes.”
construct: Longtermism beliefs / concern for welfare of future generations

justification: “Participants responded to 10 items capturing support for legal reform to protect the welfare of different entities… five items captured the target outcome, support for reform to protect the welfare of future generations.”
construct: Support for legal reform benefiting future generations

justification: “Participants were asked to indicate how morally obligated they felt to help and protect people in future generations… measurements were recorded on a 0 'No moral obligation' – 100 'Same moral obligation as someone living today' slider-scale and averaged across timeframes.”
construct: Perceived moral obligation to help future generations

justification: “Participants indicated their agreement on a 7-point Likert to six items assessing their perceptions of whether different individual and collective entities … should be doing more to protect future generations.”
construct: Perception that entities should do more for future generations
